name: R project for statistical computing
description: R software for statistical computing & graphics

projects.summary: Development of animated and interactive visualizations using the ggplot2 package.
Implementation of constraints that change over time in the gfpop algorithm for multivariate statistics.
Enhancements to the performance of multivariate normal models within the dirichletprocess package.
Improvements to the data.table package for efficient data manipulation in R.

projects.project_name: sundialr (Package for solving ODEs in R)
projects.summary: Development of a package to solve ordinary differential equations (ODEs) in R.

projects.project_name: r2sbml (An interface to SBML in R)
projects.summary: Interface development for System Biology Markup Language (SBML) within R.
Improvements to the torchvision R package for deep learning applications.
Enhancing performance testing by reusing minified R package versions across continuous integration (CI) runs.
Development work on the VedicDateTime R package for date and time handling.
Creating a testing framework for imputation methods in multivariate time series data.
Development of a new R package called DBmaps for data analysis in spatial contexts.
Development of the grepreaper package which aids in data preparation tasks in R.

table of proposed coding projects
=================================

[Jump to bottom](https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/table-of-proposed-coding-projects#wiki-pages-box) [Edit](https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/table-of-proposed-coding-projects/_edit) [New page](https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/_new)

dshilane edited this page Feb 4, 2025 · [13 revisions](https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/table-of-proposed-coding-projects/_history)

Mentors, please edit this wiki page, and add your ideas to the table below.

Contributors, please look for a project that interests you in the table below. Before emailing project mentors, please do at least one project Test and post a link to your solution on the proposal’s wiki page.

| Proposal | Hours | Status/Results | Mentors | Non-R languages? |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| [MENTORS-COPY-THIS-TEMPLATE](https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/MENTORS-COPY-THIS-TEMPLATE) |  |  |  |  |
| [Animated interactive ggplots](https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/Animated-interactive-ggplots) | 175 or 350 | Need contributor | TD Hocking, Y Fei | JavaScript |
| [Time-dependent constraints in gfpop](https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/time-dependent-constraints-in-gfpop) | 350 | Need contributor | V Runge, G Romano | C++ |
| [dirichletprocess improvements](https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/Improving-the-performance-of-multivariate-normal-models-in-dirichletprocess) | 350 | Need contributor | Dean Markwick, TD Hocking | ? |
| [data.table](https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/data.table) | 175 or 350 | Need contributor | TD Hocking, A Chetia | C |
| [sundialr-(Package-for-solving-ODEs-in-R)](https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/sundialr-%28Package-for-solving-ODEs-in-R%29) | 175 or 350 | Need contributor | S Nayak | C/C++ |
| [r2sbml-(An-interface-to-SBML-in-R)](https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/r2sbml-%28An-interface-to-SBML-in-R%29) | 175 or 350 | Need contributor | S Nayak | C/C++ |
| [torchvision in R improvements](https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/torchvision-in-R-improvements) | 175 or 350 | Need contributor | C Regouby, TD Hocking | C++ |
| [Optimizing a performance testing workflow by reusing minified R package versions between CI runs](https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/Optimizing-a-performance-testing-workflow-by-reusing-minified-R-package-versions-between-CI-runs) | 175 | Need contributor | TD Hocking, Ani | Shell |
| [Updates in VedicDateTime R Package](https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/Updates-in-VedicDateTime-R-Package) | 350 | Need contributor | ND Bokde, A Gupta |  |
| [imputeTestbench for multivariate time series](https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/imputeTestbench-for-multivariate-time-series) | 350 | Need contributor | A Gupta, ND Bokde |  |
| [DBmaps R Package Development](https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/DBmaps-R-Package-Development) | 175 | Need contributor | D Shilane, TD Hocking |  |
| [grepreaper R Package Development](https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/grepreaper-R-Package-Development) | 175 | Need contributor | D Shilane, TD Hocking | grep |

Project ideas have a ‘Status’ column which describes the current status of mentor and contributor interest. Project ideas where no contributor has yet contacted mentors should be listed as ‘need contributor’. Project ideas where one or more potential contributors are communicating with mentors should have a status of ‘potential contributors’. You can still communicate your interest to mentors to apply to projects with status “potential contributor” – that implies that there is another contributor who has already shown some capability for that project (see below for more details on how we evaluate applications). Projects that need to identify another mentor (e.g. to find a mentor with a specific skill, or from a different institution) should be marked with a status of ‘need mentor’ and the idea page should provide details in the ‘Mentors’ section.

All contributor applications will be discussed by the R mentor community, and proposals will be ranked considering factors such as quality, difficulty, and impact for the R community. Slots are a finite resource granted to R by Google, and only the best proposals will get chosen. In prior years, R has received 4-5 times more applications than slots, so application quality is key.

Contributors, if you have an idea for an R package coding project that is not listed above, please [try to find mentors by posting a description of your project idea on the r-gsoc google group](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/gsoc-r). If you find mentors, feel free to add your project idea to this wiki. You should NOT submit any project applications to Google without finding TWO mentors for your project proposal.

[](https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/_Footer/_edit "Edit footer")
